title: Astronomia Instaurata, Libris VI Comprehense, Qui de Revolutionibus Orbium Ciekestuyn Ubscribuntur (1617)
description: Astronomia Instaurata est liber sex voluminibus comprehensus, scriptus a Nicolao Copernico, qui de revolutionibus orbium cielestium subscribuntur. In hoc opere, Copernicus systema heliocentricum proponit, ubi Sol est centrum universi et planetae circum eum orbem describunt. Hic liber fuit publicatus post mortem Copernici in 1617, et fuit unum ex libris primis qui revolutionem scientiae astronomicae incitavit.This scarce antiquarian book is a facsimile reprint of the old original and may contain some imperfections such as library marks and notations. Because we believe this work is culturally important, we have made it available as part of our commitment for protecting, preserving, and promoting the world's literature in affordable, high quality, modern editions, that are true to their original work.
author: Nicolaus Copernicus
